#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Observe Mental Health Awareness Month
#Text=The United States celebrates Mental Health Awareness Month in May .
#Text=Typically , the month sparks significant media coverage as well as numerous advocacy and awareness events .
#Text=Follow these steps to observe Mental Health Awareness Month .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Get a Mental Health Check-up
#Text=Just like physical check-ups , mental health check-ups can be invaluable in detecting mental health problems before they become serious .
#Text=Consider asking for a simple evaluation from your physician or health professional for you and your family members , or take stock of your health personally .
#Text=Visit your health professional .

#Text=Talk about any troubling symptoms such as excessive anxiety , fatigue , mood swings , irritability , sadness , suicidal or violent thoughts , thoughts of death , appetite or weight changes , and any other signs that you find worrisome or debilitating .
#Text=Keep track of your symptoms .

#Text=If you suspect a mental health imbalance in yourself or a family member , consider tracking the frequency , severity , and duration of worrisome symptoms until a visit with a counselor or health professional can be arranged .
#Text=Ask for a mental health evaluation .

#Text=Mental health tests exist for conditions such as depression and bipolar disorder , and many health professionals can also identify potential personality or mood disorders , substance abuse problems , or other conditions that merit further treatment by conducting an initial evaluation during an office visit .
#Text=Attend an Advocacy or Awareness Event
#Text=Many universities , charities , hospitals , rehab centers , and advocacy organizations sponsor events to fundraise or spread awareness for mental health issues .
#Text=Search for something that interests you and consider donating your time or money to the advocacy event .
#Text=Find an event in your area .

#Text=If local hospitals or community organizations are not actively advertising an event , check lists of national organizations or check museums , concert halls , schools , and conference centers for other events .
#Text=Donate your time or money to an event .
#Text=Many organizations can benefit greatly by even small donations .
#Text=If you are unable to make a financial gift , consider donating your time as a volunteer or making a public appearance at a rally or event to show your support .
#Text=Some organizations use ribbons , colors , silence , prayer , and other free activities to spread the word about mental health issues .
#Text=Get Certified in Mental Health First Aid
#Text=Getting certified in Mental Health First Aid is an affordable , easy way to learn how to help individuals when they are experiencing a mental health emergency .
#Text=This type of training can help a loved one or even a stranger cope with a mental health crisis and get appropriate care .
#Text=Attend a local training session .
#Text=Mental Health First Aid training sessions are offered in many countries , and are available several times each year in some locations .
#Text=The sessions are available to community members , teachers , and health professionals alike .
#Text=Consider becoming a trainer .
#Text=After registering for or receiving the initial training , consider encouraging others to attend the training or learning how to train others yourself .
#Text=Use your techniques .
#Text=Once you have learned the first aid skills , do not be afraid to put them to use – they may save the life or health of someone you love .
#Text=Volunteer to Help Individuals with Mental Health Problems
#Text=One of the most helpful and satisfying ways to observe Mental Health Awareness Month is to volunteer to help individuals experiencing mental health problems .

#Text=Look for local organizations or health facilities that treat people with mental health conditions and call to offer assistance , or sign up during an awareness event for groups specifically seeking assistance .
#Text=Volunteer with a crisis hotline .
#Text=Mental health hotlines regularly need assistance answering phones and advertising their availability .
#Text=Help with a counseling organization .
#Text=Crisis centers can often use assistance with everything from paperwork to front desk work , and many may even need help offering advice and information to visitors in need .
#Text=Volunteer at a homeless shelter or rehabilitation center .
#Text=Organizations like these often deal with individuals in great need of mental health assistance as well as medical or social help .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Avoid terminology that diminishes the personhood of individuals with mental health problems , such as “ wacko , ”
#Text=“ nuts , ”
#Text=“ psycho , ” and other detrimental words .

#Text=Look for little ways to incorporate mental health awareness or promotion into your daily activities , perhaps by encouraging your coworkers to think positively or by listening carefully to someone sharing symptoms of depression with you .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not attempt to intervene in a situation in which someone is violent or highly unpredictable ; call a mental health professional for immediate assistance instead .
#Text=If you or someone else is experiencing suicidal thoughts or tendencies , call a mental health hotline or emergency services immediately .
